titles.title: Expressing the Boy Scouts of America freedom of association.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 6/16/1998--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that the Boy Scouts of America has the right, as a voluntary association, to set standards for members and leaders and should not be required against its will to accept as Scouts or Scout Leaders individuals who do not reflect the traditional and moral values of the Boy Scouts of America.
